alert.note: Alert for Lake (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 23 at 1:27PM CDT until July 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING PREVIOUSLY IN EFFECT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Cook and Lake IL. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding of roadways. Flooding of low-lying park land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 PM CDT, river gauges indicate elevated water levels due to earlier heavy rainfall. Flooding is ongoing in many areas, with multiple road closures reported. Standing water may take several hours to recede, and elevated water levels will continue to flow southward along the North Branch of the Chicago River and the Skokie River over the next several hours. Additional minor flooding is possible along these rivers in Highland Park, Northbrook, and Glencoe.
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers, creeks, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
